clinical_study.official_title: Effects of a Beach Tennis Training Session on Ambulatory Blood Pressure in Hypertensive Individuals: a Randomized Clinical Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

collaborator.agency: Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul

clinical_study.source: Hospital de Clinicas de Porto Alegre

brief_summary.textblock: This is a randomized crossover trial to evaluate acute cardiovascular responses after a Beach Tennis training session in hypertensive participants. The current hypothesis is that Beach Tennis training session will reduce ambulatory blood pressure, if compared to an usual day without any exercise (control session).

detailed_description.textblock:
Although exercise is widely recommended as a non-pharmacological therapy to reduce blood pressure (BP), the efficacy of sports practice in reduce BP is poorly investigated. In this regard, the potential anti-hypertensive effects of a Beach Tennis (BT) training session in reduce BP remain unclear, particularly in individuals with hypertension.
This is a randomized crossover trial to evaluate acute cardiovascular responses after a Beach Tennis training session in hypertensive participants. The current hypothesis is that Beach Tennis training session will reduce ambulatory blood pressure, if compared to an usual day without any exercise (control session).
Men and women aged between 35 and 65 years with the medical diagnosis of hypertension will composed the sample of this study. The primary outcome variable (i.e., 24h, daytime and nighttime systolic and diastolic blood pressure) will be assessed through outpatient blood pressure monitoring.
The participants will perform two experimental sessions in a randomized order: a 45 min BT session and a 45 min control session without any exercise. A washout period of 48h-96h between experimental sessions will be adopted.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 24 hours after control and beach tennis sessions
primary_outcome.description: Day-time, night-time and 24h ambulatory blood pressure measured through automatic oscillometric device after 45 min of control session and beach tennis session

secondary_outcome.description: Systolic blood pressure in mmHg will be measured using automatic oscillometric before and after each experimental session throughout 45 min.
Diastolic blood pressure in mmHg will be measured using automatic oscillometric before and after each experimental session throughout 45 min.

arm_group.description: Control session without any exercise. The participants will remain in seated rest throughout 45 min.
The participants will perform a beach tennis training session throughout 45 min.

intervention.description: The Beach Tennis training session will be composed by a warm up of 5 min of BT in which technical exercises (i.e., serve, volley, forehand and backhand) will be performed After that, 3 BT small games of 12 min with a 2 minute interval between games using the conventional rules of sport will be performed. Before the session and after each small game, data regarding heart rate, blood pressure and rate perceived exertion will be recorded.
